Review.Titre: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE.  STAY AWAY
Review.Contenu: Like many others, If I could rate this -10 I would.  I signed up for the Passion Plus program, a 15K USD program as it was promissed to be a "done for you" experience, and a roadmap of what to do first, second, third etc.  Well, other than a spreadsheet with various technical things I needed to do such as creat a google business app account etc, there was no "roadmap". Granted, I had some difficulties too.   I had a broken arm and it wasn't healing as quickly as I had anticipated...so recording fitness programs had to go on hold....Then I had a family crisis with a sudden death that needed my attention to family members.... So not much was accomplished as a result from Nov when I had my kick-off call to April.  Then when I finally got working on the app, I felt overwhelmed as there was no roadmap......so I asked for a 3-month "break".  They continued to bill me in July by taking the final payment, and never reached back out.  The program is supposed to offer bi-weekly 1-1 coaching.... It doesn't.....or at least it didn't in my case as I only received a handful of such calls, and it was me who finally reached out 6 months later in September and said, ummm is anyone there?  If I were billing a client that much money and promising a specific outcome, I would be on them, and at the very least, trying to find out why they are MIA and how I could be of service.   When I finally did reach someone, Jarret, he admitted that there was some "breakdown" on their side.  I asked him to tell me whether he believed they had delivered on their promises.  He never answered my question but had offered to "extend" my program by a few months.  Generous since they are the ones who didn't deliver on their promise.... It gets quite complicated, but after asking about a new program they have, "Expert Growth," and I just really wanted to know what it was about, they convinced me to say "yes" to this program that they said was currently being billed at "5K". Then I get an email saying that my "membership" had been "downgraded" and that I no longer had access to the VIP Passion Plus program.  I never agreed to being "downgraded" and what I want is to simply be given what I paid for and what I was promised.... a freek'n roadmap of how to put together an app.....  They have no phone number, and it takes weeks to hear back from anyone.  I did ask for a refund since they failed deliver on their promises..... I am still waiting to hear back... I will update as to just how long that takes and what the resolution is...... extreemly frustrating, so if you don't want this in your life, stay away from PASSION.IO.

Review.Titre: REFUSAL OF A REFUND!! DO NOT TRUST THIS COMPANY
Review.Contenu: REFUSAL OF A REFUND! DO NOT SIGN UP FOR A FREE 30 DAY TRIAL. Review.Titre: I was in hospital for a month…
Review.Contenu: I was in hospital for a month recovering from colon cancer emergency operation and had a complication afterwards which meant that I was not handling any of my business. During this time Passion IO took £809 from my account for my year's subscription. I contacted them to politely request a refund because I cannot work on my app due to my situation and subsequent months of chemo and quite frankly needed the money because I couldn't work, and explained that I was in hospital for a month, throwing up diarrhea, having a tube shoved down my throat while I was awake, a central line trying to stay alive, and sent them photos and doctors notes etc in the hopes that they would respond with kindness and help me. But they chose not to. Their "reason" (excuse) is that I should have requested a refund within 30 days. What, while I was fighting to stay alive you mean? I couldn't deal with anything how on earth was I to deal with business? I guess my cancer didn't really care too much about Passion IO's arbitrary rules. The truth is, they can choose to do whatever they want, they can bend the rules and they can be kind and gracious, they have just chosen to be mercenary. I had drunk the cool aid and thought they were the real deal but I guess they are just money hungry, unsympathetic, mean people. Dan should be ashamed of himself for treating another human being this way.

Review.Titre: I lost loyal customers
Review.Contenu: Worst experience ever. everything was frustrating, from getting to know the backend, to customers not being able to login, and even cancelling was hell.#1when cancelling, they don't allow you to download your own trainings. I had 90% organized on my desktop but taking me days to somehow locate or recreate the remaining 10%>#2 the backend is a chaos and insufficent, there literally is no member section, only a very, very limited order section#3 the setup guide is way too limited, i had to keep asking the support desk for help at every step#4 my customers had consistent problems with paying, finding the app, the content disappearing from their ap and getting a blank screen and needing to reinstall, etc. have never had so much dissatisfaction with my clients#5 there is no distinction between product and checkout, making the backend chaotic#6 no keeping track of VAT for european customers#7 impossible to see how many people are in your programs at a given moment, as there is no member section#8 export of member data not possible, as no member section#9 export function of orders way too limited, only email and date are exported, at first not even what order they placed, that has been solved, but no name!! only email, no country (for VAT), etc etc#10 in order section there is literally no column for name, only email. To find whether someone ihas already been added to a certain course, you need to find their email, use earch, click on their name, and then view a popup. so time consuming#11 when complaining about missing features, hardly anything changesThere is probably more that I forgot, am moving to a different system which is such a relief. Only coming back today to cancel and all the furstration of the past year is coming back. Worst thing, I lost loyal high ticket customers because they were so frustrated with how bad the app functioned.if you are considering buying, please don't save yourself the frustrationa nd the loss of your clientsPS as you can see by this review, i am detailed person and gave precise feedback. doing what i can to make things better. they invited me at a team meeting to share but hardly anything changed. so glad my initial year was over and i shifted

Review.Titre: Beware of the Subscription Renewal Process - Opaque at best. Illegal at worst. Issue Requires Resolution
Review.Contenu: I recently had a negative experience with Passion.io that left me feeling quite disappointed and frustrated. In fact, it has been the worst online transaction experience I've had in my life.  While I believe in the potential of their platform, there was an issue with their subscription renewal process that I think needs to be addressed and corrected.Initially drawn to the platform's promise of being a fitting solution for my business, last year when I signed up for the service, I had high hopes. However, the reality fell short, as the app lacked key functions and didn't adapt to my needs as I had anticipated. The decision to discontinue use was my own responsibility, and I accept that.What I cannot accept, though, is the opaque and bewildering subscription renewal process that followed a year later. Without any prior communication, messages, notifications or alerts, my account was charged directly from my bank account for another year's subscription. I didn't even receive a single notification or a confirmation email of this renewal, leaving me unaware until it was too late.It's worth noting that Passion.io has a 30-day money-back refund policy, which seems fair ON THE SURFACE. However, this policy is rendered almost meaningless by the fact that they fail to notify users of the impending renewal. This lack of transparency makes it difficult to exercise one's right to a refund, and at worst, it appears to walk a thin line with legality. Unfortunately, I'm not the only person to have encountered this disheartening scenario. A quick glance at other reviews in Trustpilot indicates that this might be a systemic issue, rather than an isolated incident.I genuinely believe in the potential for Passion.io to empower users in their pursuits, but this experience has cast a shadow over that belief. I urge Passion.io to rectify this situation urgently by not only addressing my case and issuing me a refund but also by improving their communication and renewal processes for the sake of all users.As someone who values open communication, accountability, and fairness, I sincerely hope to see a swift resolution to this matter. Your users deserve to be treated with respect and transparency.

Review.Titre: The worst experience ever with money…
Review.Contenu: The worst experience ever with money spent on a product I never received.Months and months of back and forth with everything being completed on my end but nothing completed on there’s. With no refund of money, and last email taking a month for a responseUpdate: they seem to reply very quickly when called out publiclyUpdate: you missed many things.From the start, I was promised a few things when I signed up through webinar that were never delivered to me. This was reported and never rectified. The webinar stated the charge was going to be (for that day only which I signed up that day)  in whatever currency you were signing up in for example if it was $999, that was it whether it was Canadian or US you were being charged $999 you currency , however, I was charged conversion rate which ended up being over $300 more again. I thought your company was worth it I talked to representative they apologized and said they would update the webinar and we moved on.The other items promised a ring light and some other things. I honestly don’t remember off the top of my head were never ever delivered to me. I reported that with no response or rectification, and I have no idea if it was on you guys or the shipping company but either way I never received. There was a delay for a month where you guys weren’t doing anything, but I had been told that the app was in processing. Your team never reached out to me. I had to hound them with numerous emails before they realized error was on them so to rectify they offered me free months again never received because I cancelled acct, we’re a month behind now.Once the app finally did go into processing and was approved, yes, my app was approved right away because I ensured I had done absolutely everything I was told. There was never an ability to take payment that was on Apple, however, I reached out to your team and yes this was finally rectified weeks later please remember at this point I believe I was four months in and could not take a payment from a client did not have an active app. Then the app never functioned properly after that. There was only one part of it that was ever actually completed by apple when there should have been numerous options available for people to purchase continually being a problem people were reporting to me, which again I report it to Apple and let your team know. I was so frustrated at this point with not getting emails back. I had even reached out to Dan on Facebook which took a week which took a week for an automated message. replied saying we’re really glad that somebody got back to you because by the time he had somebody had already emailed me not with a solution they had just emailed me the directions on what I needed to do with Apple. I finally got extremely frustrated with your team since it had been over six months and I did not have a functioning app and had completed everything that I was told I had to do and it was just continuing to get the runaround.Then recently, I finally went ahead and cancelled my account which took you guys many weeks to get back to me.There was much back-and-forth on what I needed to do  so i did not continue to be charged. Last email sent was December 4 wanting to ensure none of my information. My intellectual property was still left with your company or apple, and it took you guys till January 4 to reply.upPassion boasts a 30 day moneyback guarantee however, you know that the information you provide takes 30 days to go through,  yes you could skip ahead but for those of us who didn’t have experience in creating an app we need to follow it step-by-step.so you would not even have an app in 30 days it took much longer for me to Discover the level of incompetence and that I wanted a refund and it should have been provided either in full or in part due to all of these issues. Instead, you continually just offered free months to a client that was unhappy and didn’t get what they were promised.

Review.Titre: Horrible Experience So Far..
Review.Contenu: My business partner and I, joined passion back in May of this year, and up to this date, Passion has let us down with several reoccurring problems. These problems include a big lack in timely responses, not providing timely updates as it pertains to our app submission process, and a major lack in customer support. For example, we sent an email to Passion on August 8th and we didn’t hear back from Passion until August 14th, and the reason that was explained to us is because one person was on holiday. Events such as these are definitely unacceptable, especially when we’re paying $297 a month for the ultimate package. The support, or lack thereof, hasn’t matched what we’ve been paying on a monthly basis. We have major events that we’re planning for our company, which is predicated off of our app and when we can start. The lack of timely responses, lack of support, and waiting sometimes 5 or more days before we can even get a phone call with someone has been a horrible experience to say the least. Even now, currently, all we’re told is “we’ll improve”, and we have yet to see any improvements. For about two weeks now, we've been told that a "bug" is the reason why our app hasn't been successfully submitted, and we haven't heard back from Passion since. I've sent countless emails to Passion, and Dan, and we have yet to receive a response from anyone, and at this point it feels like we've been taken advantage of. We've been waiting three months for our app to be up and ready to go, after initially being promised that this would be a 30 day process. At this point, frustrated is an understatement.

Review.Titre: A bad course platform
Review.Contenu: Hey everyone! I’ve recently stopped using passion.io due to the app never properly functioning and the tech support being really low. I think it’s important to share my experience as I seen a ton of people unsure about the app and it’s success. I think it should be communicated that the same way they teach you to sell courses as an in progress app that is in the growing phase so is passion.io. If I did not already have the means of selling my high ticket items outside this app I would have had a even bigger loss to my business due to the horrible support of passion.I signed up in December 2021 and as of April 2022 none of the issues had been fixed.The ability to not be able to use the newest feature The community channel, was the breaking point for me.My bugs so far:FAQ issue where the FAQ just shows a blank page.Community channel feature not working.Loading screen still the wrong image from the Begging of my app.Native apps not having the ability to edit to submit.Lag and skipping through videos that are uploaded through the app.Incorrect logo and name upon download of the native app.Android loading issue when users access the app which does not allow scrolling.Android users not able to access the app at all in its native form.Since I’ve launched this app I have not been able to access its features. On top of that, all my sales 60+ subscribers are all generated through social media, which completely goes against Passion Dan advertisement. I signed up from his ad saying you don’t need social media but then in the challenge they tell you to post on social media 🤔😕🤷🏽‍♂️Each month since December, almost on a weekly basis I have reached out to the passion support team to fix the bugs that have stopped my business from growing. The support has been poor as I reported issues and it takes and even weeks to get a solution, a solution that does not fix the issues. After months of frustration I’ve moved my courses alto teachable and have gotten immediate results. Upon cancellation, they refused to refund me and even told me my app hasn’t been updated since December 29th 2021, that’s why my bugs were so heavy. I SAY THIS FROM THE BOTTOM OF MY HEART, do not use this platform to grow your teaching business. There are so much better platforms with true success who naturally offer apps that actually work. Invest in your business and in yourself not Passion.io or Dan.

Review.Titre: Tread carefully when joining passion
Review.Contenu: *UPDATE*Having promised they would get in touch to give me compensation, no such thing has happened. I was doubtful about the integrity of this company but now I am downright disappointed and would go as far as to say it's all about looking good but they do not care beyond that. What compensation was going to be made to me I wonder? I would feel some kind of refund would be fair as I was falsely sold something but it seems at most I would be offered a 'free extension' of my membership which would only ever be of any value if I was willing and able to make future payments. Why would I continue to pay into something that lacks any integrity and doesn't serve me? It's clever. They look as if they might care and are giving back to you but they are actually just trying to make more money out of you. I did expect an email however, when they stated they would contact me via email. I have checked all inboxes and junk box for weeks and nothing. That is just outright lying. Avoid this company, they just want your money.Original review:Tread carefully when joining passion. There are A LOT of hidden costs and it wasn't clear to me that you'll not only be paying the huge fee for the course but in order to have the app you create with them you'll have to pay a monthly subscription of quite a lot of money. For me it was half the money I have to join the course. I wasn't given the support I needed as someone with learning difficulties- the only support call was a group joining call went way too quickly for me and I was only shown the 1 to 1 help service after it was too late to get a refund. It's sold as a 'this will work for everyone' technique but actually, I was later told in my 1 to 1 call that maybe I needed to do it my own way and it doesn't work for everyone the same. It's so misleading. These people are really, really good at sales. They don't really care much about your personal welfare. It's a lot of talk about figures but not so much substance or support. I felt a bit foolish to have given over half of what I had to people that openly advertise they're making 6 or 7 digit figures. And this is another reason I stopped the course. I wasn't comfortable asking for huge amounts of money from people who don't have much, to make myself loads of money. That's essentially what they're doing. If you have plenty of money then maybe this works for you, but this was marketed to someone like me, on very low income, that it could solve my problems.  It just created a bigger problem, I have nothing for the money I paid which was $997. Literally nothing to show for that. I received a lot of lazy correspondence with the team not reading my messages properly and only willing to help me once it was too late. I wish this money was not in the pockets of people that boast about the large figures they have whilst I struggle to find work. I do not recommend signing up for passion fighters as you're fixed into many extra payments and an ongoing membership system and if you leave have absolutely nothing to show for it.

Review.Titre: NO PROBLEMS WITH THE SERVICE UNTIL I ATTEMPTED TO CANCEL
Review.Contenu: I had no problems with the service until I attempted to cancel.  There were some items I just couldn’t ignore for my particular preference.  Mainly being co-branded with their platform.  There is training if you’re brand new.  There is a Facebook community if you need that sort of thing. For the first 30 days (the refund period) they send you constant email communication.  After that, there is no follow up.  No “I see you haven’t logged in” No type of check up.  Just during the cancellation period so keep that in mind as you begin.  The system is also drag and drop so you can build easily within those limits.  Now I chose to pay a little more for a month to month membership.  I wanted to test the waters and felt it was worth it.For me at this moment, I wanted more, and so I finally decided to just cancel.  I allowed them to continue charging my account $97 for months while I was inactive and still deciding.  When I finally decided 3 months ago to cancel, there is no link in your account to cancel.  No "pink button," as indicated. Nothing.  You have to Goggle how to cancel your account.  Then you fill out a long form in which they make several attempts to keep draining your account to place it on hold.  A nuisance yes, but an understandable business move.  However, you get zero confirmation your account is canceled, just an email address to contact if you want additional coaching for the app.  An understandable SCAM move.  Therefore, they can and will always state “they show no records’ or “can’t find the form submission.” On my third attempt to cancel, I finally sent an email to that email address to seek confirmation of my cancellation and my refund.  I did not seek a refund from day one, as I did attempt to use the service and I did take up space on their server.  However I did and am expecting a  refund from the additional two months and additional two cancellation forms I had to fill out.  Now that I’m asking for a refund, I've since received 6 emails from them, none of which acknowledges my cancellation.  All of which are still attempting to keep me and hold on to my money.  Luckily, I use a burner account to add money to each month to pay for my ‘on the fence’ services with new companies.  Even then, Passion seems to have a tracker on when I add money, because they’ve instantly stolen 2 additional payments after my cancellation attempts as soon as money hits the account.  I’d be truly horrified if they had my actual banking. Any thought I had to potentially come back if the co-branding situation changed has gone out the window.  If you’re willing to steal $97 per month then how can I trust you with my brand?  This review is not meant to drag them down, but inform you of what you face should you choose to cancel.  If you know, that you know, that a co-branded, drag and drop app is for you; then there is nothing wrong with this platform.  Understand that after 30 days you are on your own unless you seek out support.  But again, it’s still better than most.  However, if you’re on the fence, expect delays and run around when trying to cancel.

Review.Titre: ABSOLUTELY HORRIFIC
Review.Contenu: Absolutely horrific. I have been waiting a total of 39 days now for my APPS to go live, I am incurring costs my end with no way to offset them against revenue because of Passion's complete failure in customer service.I have reached out to the support team around 20 times in total now with the most detailed response being told I need to wait. Recently support emails have gone completely unanswered. On my initial onboarding call I was promised great service from 'Marck', yet he has not replied to my email from April 12th, and the entire process is costing me to lose money each day the app is not live.Calls for 'on-boarding' are available immediately, yet you have to wait around 10 days for a call for the submission process, which is then met by fluffy details and no accurate information.Close to getting a solicitor involved now. I am even being billed the wrong amount, as I signed up for the $300 plan and they are billing me $97?UPDATE: 21st May - Spoke to the owner who was very polite and courteous. However, my questions about features that are broken, content that disappears still remain unanswered and there is a clear disconnect between the support team and the development. I waste my time writing long emails with my issues in great details to be told to book a call with someone who hasn't got a clue what my project is, or who has read my emails. Going to see if they can deliver, but I am not holding my hopes up. The $200 doesn't really mean anything as I'm already losing thousands of dollars on coaching and licensing fees because the app is 51 days late, and still not appearing on iOS or Android. Will update in the next week to see if anyone can take charge of my project and deliver.UPDATE 27th May:Received an email to say my app had gone live to Google. This was after it sat in the Google Play Store blank for 3 weeks. I noticed the logo had updated so both myself and my partner downloaded the updated version, so I could be sure it wasn't caching on my end. What we downloaded contained no content and was just all Passiom screens. The entire process now, roughly 55 days later is beyond amateur. Lost all hope completely. Built web products and digital products myself for 15 years with developers, agencies, and teams, and I honestly can say I've never come across a team so incompetent in my entire life.UPDATE 28TH MAYMy account was frozen on the basis Passion could not deliver the product, irrespective of the fact I made them aware on multiple occasions both the failure of the product, and the subsequent delays have cost me dramatically.I am now instructing my lawyer in the US, as I am now $15,000 out of pocket having prepared everything for the platform specifically.Overview:- 60 Days ago it was meant to go live- I have sent over 100+ emails - Website deleted all tracking information I had put in multiple times- Website failed to upload certain images, the button would not work on multiple browsers- App was pushed live to Android twice with zero content, and just passion branding. - I believe I was lied too about the update times, as I very much doubt Google takes 3 weeks to publish an update.- Made the company aware multiple times throughout the process I was losing money with the delays, they didn't want to know.- Have a live support person for "sales" but nobody for technical support - Product does not work and has been demonstrated multiple times through various trustpilot reviews.- Charged various billing amounts incorrect and in breach of contract.

Review.Titre: Approach with caution if just starting out
Review.Contenu: I enrolled in the 30-day challenge but like many others, I hit a wall when I realized I was being coached to sell an app to potential customers when I hadn’t built it. Nonetheless, I pushed on, but I’m not the sort of person who can sell something that doesn’t exist yet.  On day 28 you get referred to the app building process (having tried to sell it already). They suggest you film yourself teaching on Zoom using Google slides and then upload it for the first week of your app content- then your customers can access the content, which you build as you go from then on, while the app is running. There are problems with this process. Firstly, you are advised to use social media accounts to get customers for your app which is fine if you have a large following interested in your service, but not if you’re starting out and have yet to gain a following. Then you are marketing to friends and family who may not be interested in your professional service given your relationships are not based on work. Next, building an app while customers are using it is an incredibly stressful process. Should you become ill for example (as I did), they could get to week two and you have been unable to film and upload content in time. The whole process seems to be driven by creating high levels of anxiety- from midway through the challenge. Running a start-up is stressful enough without having lots of additional anxieties caused. In addition, I purchased an app development service in three installments of $397, then found out I needed to start paying the same amount again every month from month 6 to retain my app. This monthly expense creates additional pressures if you are starting out and are still building a following. I became ill at the end of the 30-day challenge and have been unable to film content (I’ve had a serious eye infection for almost a month). Thankfully, I didn’t sell my app before building it, or else I’d be in a mess now with new customers. All things considered, given my ongoing medical condition I have asked for a refund. My request was met with an automated response that directed me around a list of articles that were not responsive to my particular situation. I have been told after receiving a call from Dan that I have to prove I had an account with this company. Are they are telling Trustpilot I never had an account? I did get a refund of my final month's payment, and have requested a refund of month two, while accepting I learned a lot about sales from month one. However, I signed up for an app development course, not a sales course. The sales advice is also faulty for start-ups, let me explain as I did to Dan himself by WhatsApp- "Facebook ads have a very limited success rate for small businesses starting out given the algorithms favour those with large followings and bigger budgets. I’d already spent a lot on FB ads before coming to Passion. In the old days, social media platforms were a great help to start ups and SMEs as attracting fresh traffic was easy and free through interacting as your business page (I had a lot of success launching new e-learning courses for universities and colleges that way), but these days you cannot interact as your business page with other pages or users, and your page has a limited reach without a big budget or lots of followers, partly due to new laws governing data privacy in the EU, USA, and UK." So FB ads don't work as they once did, not for start-ups. This company preys on the hopes and dreams of start-ups. That's how they make so much money. Steer clear.

Review.Titre: Bait and Switch- esque
Review.Contenu: Good for no code app building. But they advertised many things that they don't have. It is 100% a bait and switch. But good for bare minimum app building. BARE MINIMUM...like, they don't even ask for your users name when they sign up. They also have no livestreaming capabilities.EDIT: Native app live streaming feature is a MUST! That's honestly why I signed up because it was in the ads that we wouldn't need other 3rd party tools. Having to rely on YouTube sucks. I signed up when they announced in app Livestreaming and Zoom capabilities in September 2022, banking on this. Then they postponed it despite this being the only reason I chose passion. That's why I say bait and switch-esque.

Review.Titre: I am in my first week of passion.io and…
Review.Contenu: I am in my first week of passion.io and I really want this to work but the customer support has just been a nightmare for me. The website is down, and won't load videos after day 2. Nobody from the company is responding. I can't get a 1 on 1 app ninja to help me. Its super frustrating.

Review.Titre: Sitting on the Fence
Review.Contenu: The concept is great, it appears there are many success stories. My experience has been challenging with endless technical issues, poor customer service (a tech issue over looked after endless emails) and lacking important information relating to options not brought to my attention. Finally, I have 'full' access to my app on my cell and the progress indicators are accurate after 6 months. I have not launched yet. Hopefully, no more issues and I can come back and give Passion.io a 5 star.

Review.Titre: Tired of surveys
Review.Contenu: Tired of surveys , need to generate business, need one coach not 5 coaches asking for surveys . my day would be spent writing surveys ? LOL

Review.Titre: Disappointed and Fed up
Review.Contenu: Like I said, every time I complete a day, I complete the widgets, click complete and it doesn't allow you to click on complete.  This has been communicated to you far too many times. I completely give up.

Review.Titre: Passion.io is NOT what it seems
Review.Contenu: Although Dan is a very charming and charismatic salesman, the Passion.io platform aims to bleed you of money to create an app that is not rocket science nor the only outfit out there. Passion.io teaches you the basics of building an online business and eventually an app but it's not for all goods and services. For example, if you don't have a huge social following or presence, it will be hard to get many people to sign up for your program. I also did NOT appreciate the super slimy sales scripts the other Passion.io partners pushed. It felt really sleazy and off-putting. Many of the lessons that Passion.io teaches you do not apply to all types of businesses and it would be hard to launch certain types of businesses. This was originally for a fitness app but it is not one size fits all. They also start charging you $300 a month for nothing. It's ridiculous!!! Be very careful of this company or you will lose a LOT of money!!!

Review.Titre: Fake reviews and appalling product/service.
Review.Contenu: The reviews you’re reading are incentivised for discounts and further product access with the passion academy. Don’t believe them. If you are a (very) small influencer happy to use a (very, very) sub par web app service and don’t mind providing a poor customer experience to you clients - Then this is the platform for you. Support can take weeks if not months to resolve any issue and you’ll be guaranteed to receive generic automated responses most the time. The platform is buggy beyond belief. As a highly tech literate person, myself and my team were confronted with countless crashes, bugs, errors etc when building and also deploying our app. My guess is the business model is preying on once off orders who will never actually use the app and not kick up a fuss. You are likely to waste hours, lose income and your sanity working with Dan and his “team” In terms of what you get for what you pay, it is simply not worth it with other far superior providers out there. Working on the passion platform madeMe want to learn how to code an app from scratch because the experience has been so poor.

Review.Titre: Not happy with the OFFER of savings wording BUT they did rectify my personal complaint
Review.Contenu: UPDATED 28TH NOVEMBERI have moved the review up from 1 star to 3 star and will constantly reappraise if things get better from now. Below is my original comments that justified a 1 star review. To their credit they did respond and rectify the issue and give me the original offer they had offered. BUT still not more than 3 stars because I have lost 2 days worrying about this and not been as productive as I would have liked. Secondly I still believe the marketing is misleading. I am sure they are not alone in this kind of word play. " original 1 star reasons" Do not trust this company. In short I pay $97 per month. When I went to update my credit card they offered the chance to pay annually and save $240. BUT that is not what you'd think.Actually what was on offer was a step up to the next plan for the same money I already pay. That is NOT what they said in the notification. I was ready to commit to them for a year because I thought I'd save over $240 over the year but when I complained they did nothing except say 'No you do not understand, you get a better plan that would have cost you more, hence the saving' I explained that this is not what they offered. It does not physically save me any money, I am in fact, paying the same.

Review.Titre: You need tutoring

Review.Titre: more support and guidance

I would like to have more advice and guidance from the Passion.io, to have more Info: what to do and when, step by step guidance. Review.Titre: I give this three and a half stars
Review.Contenu: I give this three and a half stars. I'll start with what's right about this app. It's relatively easy to upload content into the backend of the app. The chat support was very helpful in figuring out any info I missed. I also love that the app can be easily accesible on a computer as well and the process is seamless. With that said, it was difficult in the beginning for my potential customers to sign up. I lost money as when they finally go into the app, their credit card payments were denied.  Much of the directions were not clear or missing steps. Good thing the live chat option was highly helpful. I also wish there were more widgets, maybe more interactive ones. It's highly possible I don't know all I'm talking about too as this is my first app.

Review.Titre: Wonderful opportunity to get introduced…
Review.Contenu: Wonderful opportunity to get introduced to app building.  Unfortunately, high ticket for additional mentoring. Success definitely depends in discipline, consistency, and complting the lessons.

Review.Titre: I enrolled with Passion 6 months ago…
Review.Contenu: I enrolled with Passion 6 months agoI started OK but lost momentum and then stopped following their plan.  I didn't manage to complete their recommended course and didn't even begin with my app. I'm disappointed in myself.  But I hope I can work through the material I have and rejoin at a later date.
